front:
[砖专专转] Study: Frailty and the brain: A narrative review of functional and pathological correlates.

What was the main finding?
back:
However, the structural, functional, and pathological changes in the brain associated with frailty remain insufficiently explored

 Sciancalepore Francesco, Salemme Simone, Valletta Martina et al. (2026)
 https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/41253248/

front: [砖专专转] Based on Sciancalepore Francesco et al. (2026), what clinical practice change might be considered?
back:
Finding: Numerous MRI-based studies have shown that frailty is associated with vascular brain damage, mostly consisting of increased white matter hyperintensity volumes, and with reduced gray matter volumes

Clinical relevance: Consider this evidence when treating elderly patients with frailty-related conditions.

 Full study: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/41253248/

front:
[砖专专转] Study: Frailty and cardiovascular disease: a bidirectional relationship with clinical implications.

What was the main finding?
back:
Frailty and cardiovascular disease (CVD) are increasingly recognized as interconnected conditions that significantly impact aging populations

 Johnson Neil, Qu Junru, Wagatsuma Kenji et al. (2025)
 https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/41282339/

front: [砖专专转] Based on Johnson Neil et al. (2025), what clinical practice change might be considered?
back:
Finding: Frailty, characterized by reduced physiological resilience and increased vulnerability to stressors, affects 10%-15% of community-dwelling older adults and is associated with adverse CVD outcomes.

Clinical relevance: Consider this evidence when treating elderly patients with frailty-related conditions.

 Full study: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/41282339/

front:
[爪] Study: Potential targets of microglia in the treatment of neurodegenerative diseases: Mechanism and therapeutic implications.

What was the main finding?
back:
Microglial over-activation is closely associated with the secretion of pro-inflammatory cytokines, the phagocytosis of injured neurons, and the modulation of neurotoxic environments

 Zhao Wenhui, Liu Zhongxuan, Wu Jiannan et al. (2026)

front:
[住专拽驻] Study: International society of sports nutrition position stand: 尾-hydroxy-尾-methylbutyrate (HMB).

What was the main finding?
back:
The available safety/toxicity data suggest that chronic HMB-Ca and HMB-FA consumption are safe for oral HMB supplementation in humans up to at least one year

 Rathmacher John A, Pitchford Lisa M, Stout Jeffrey R et al. (2025)

back:

front:
[ 砖 住专] Study: The impact of ageing on the structural compositions of the mucosa of human colon.

What was the main finding?
back:
